snippet: The iPhone 7 doesn’t have a place to plug in headphones, but that is far from its worst shortcoming. The new device is an example of how Apple’s aesthetics have gone stale....
abstract: Farhad Manjoo State of the Art column comments that lack of headphone jack in Apple's latest iPhones 7 and 7 Plus is far from product's most egregious shortcoming; notes that phones lack dazzle and look mostly same as older models, staleness also observed by many industrial designers and tech critics.
lead_paragraph: The iPhone 7 doesn’t have a place to plug in headphones, but that is far from its worst shortcoming. The new device is an example of how Apple’s aesthetics have gone stale.

headline.print_headline: Never Mind That Jack. the Dazzle Is Missing.
headline.main: What’s Really Missing From the New iPhone: Cutting-Edge Design
